thread.title: Black Simon and Garfunkel Joined by Real Art Garfunkel for 'Can't Feel My Face'
thread.title_full: Black Simon and Garfunkel Joined by Real Art Garfunkel for 'Can't Feel My Face'

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Black Simon and Garfunkel Joined by Real Art Garfunkel for 'Can't Feel My Face'
text:
Comments The Root's Questlove and Captain Kirk Douglas are joined by the actual Art Garfunkel for The Weeknd's hit and a little bit of 'The Boxer'. 
" The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon " brought back Black Simon and Garfunkel for its Wednesday night, September 30 episode. The Roots ' Questlove and Captain Kirk Douglas reprised their roles as members of the duo when they performed a cover of The Weeknd 's "Can't Feel My Face". Black Simon and Garfunkel have been putting their spin on popular songs for Jimmy Fallon 's late-night shows for years, but they made their latest performance more special by bringing out the real Art Garfunkel during the song. The 73-year-old musician entered the stage right before they tackled the chorus. The trio then continued singing The Weeknd's hit single and closed out the rendition with a little bit of the real Simon & Garfunkel 's "The Boxer". Garfunkel's appearance on "Tonight Show" came less than a month after his former partner Paul Simon joined a Paul Simon tribute band called Troubled Waters during an episode of " The Late Show with Stephen Colbert ". Simon played "Me and Julio Down by the Schoolyard" alongside his new bandmates at that time.
